alert.note: Alert for Houston; Peach (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 29 at 7:51AM EDT by NWS Atlanta
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Peach and central Houston Counties through 815 AM EDT... At 751 AM EDT, a strong thunderstorm was over Lakewood, or 9 miles northeast of Fort Valley, moving south at 25 mph. HAZARD...Up to 40 mph wind, frequent cloud to ground lightning and heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect minor damage to tree limbs and blowing around of light, unsecured objects. Heavy rain may cause temporary street flooding especially in poor drainage areas. Locations impacted include... Perry, Warner Robins, Centerville, Byron, Meadowdale, Sand Bed, Houston Lake, Lakewood, Powerville, Moss Oak, Bonaire, Miami Valley, Kathleen, and Elberta. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: People outdoors should seek shelter immediately. If you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning. Motorists should slow down and be prepared for possible loss of control due to hydroplaning.
